context: Hey there. Can I recommend something to watch?
Hello! I'm looking for a good movie based on a book.
Hmmmm. I don't suppose you like Twilight (2008) ?
An example of that would be The Cider House Rules (1999) . I read the book and saw the movie. The book was better.
I certainly didn't, lol. Oh, I've never seen that one.
Yes, I actually do like Twilight (2008) . I haven't seen that in awhile. Read the series. My guilty pleasure.
Haha, well to each her own.
Right! If you have ever seen The World According to Garp (1982) , The Cider House Rules (1999) is by the same author, John Irving.
resp: Another movie that is based on a book is Old Yeller (1957)

context.content: Hello
Hi! What kind of movies do you like?
I like movies that are funny, emotional, and family-friendly. Do you have any recommendations for me?
context.feelings: I hope the recommender understands my preferences and recommends a movie that is both humorous and entertaining, emotional and thought-provoking, and heartwarming and wholesome. I'll be disappointed if the recommendations don't align with what I'm looking for. I really hope the recommender gets it right this time.

context.content: I love comedies! Have you seen The Hangover (2009)?
I haven't seen The Hangover. Can you tell me more about it?
context.feelings: I'm a bit disappointed that the recommender suggested "The Hangover" as it's not really a family-friendly movie. I was hoping for something that's both funny and suitable for the whole family. I wish the recommender had understood my preferences better.

context.content: It's about a group of friends who have to go out to eat and end up in a lot of trouble. It's pretty funny. It has Adam Sandler and Vince Vaughn. It is about a bunch of friends going out to have a great time. It also has some really funny moments.
That sounds funny, but I'm also looking for something emotional and family-friendly. Do you have any other recommendations?
context.feelings: I'm disappointed that the recommended movie doesn't seem to cover all the genres I'm looking for. It sounds funny, but it doesn't seem to be emotional or family-friendly. I wish the recommender understood my preferences better. I hope the next recommendation will be more aligned with what I'm looking for.
